column1: Quiz on Set Theory and Logic
What is the union of sets A = {1, 2} and B = {2, 3}?
What is the intersection of sets A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {3, 4}?
If P is true and Q is false, what is the truth value of P ∧ Q?
Which of the following is a subset of A = {1, 2}?
What is the cardinality of the power set of {a, b}?
What is the negation of the statement 'It is raining'?
Which of the following statements is a tautology?
What is the difference between sets A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3}?
What is the complement of set A = {1, 2} in universal set U = {1, 2, 3, 4}?
If a proposition is always false, it is called a?
